page.title: 10A SHOP-KEEPER IN BURTON
page.content: Mrs. Jackets owns a fabric and haberdashery shop in a secondary shopping area in Burton. She financed the shop by selling her house, and now serves around a thousand customers a week, with the help of two part-time staff. Mrs. Jackets puts in a full day at the shop, and many hours over-time. Although Burton is not a huge town, it is a growing one, and being a brewery town it has never suffered large-scale unemployment,so it is a good place to run a shop, although many people prefer to have a day out shopping in one of the larger cities that are only an hour's drive away. As it is not in the main shopping centre, some customers are lost because parking is poor.In spite of high rates, Mrs.Jackets enjoys her work, especially meeting people, buying fabrics,and being her own boss.
